column4: i'm trying to compile stud (https://github.com/bumptech/stud). i have libev4, libev-dev, and libssl-dev installed, but it's acting like it can't find either of these things. http://pastebin.com/drmg81Tv i was wondering if anyone would be able to help. I'm @ ubuntu 11.10
have you tried (if possible) passing appropriate ./configure switches?
there aren't any. it's just a make file.  it doesn't look like it points the compiler anywhere specific
Edit the include and library path in the makefile then
there isn't one
Could you paste the Makefile in a pastebin, please?
it's in the repo i linked to (https://github.com/bumptech/stud/blob/master/Makefile)
mine's unmodified from the repo
just a minute
np:) thanks for your help
are you running on a 32 or 64 bit system?
try adding at line 11 (the one starting with LDFLAGS) the following text: -L/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/
sorry for the delay. minor problem here, resolved now. LDFLAGS = -lssl -lcrypto -lev -L/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/ is my line, same probelm
Sorry too, I was called. Could you please move the -L switch so it is before the -l ones?
sure.  it's been a while, i forgot order mattered
same errors:(
could you add the -v flag to CFLAGS and LDFLAGS and paste the log in a pastebin?
http://pastebin.com/fWkd6Tad
Try doing a "make clean" and rebuild with "make". I have no other idea...
i always do a make clean before i make:-\ thanks for your help
You're welcome (though I didn't solve your problem)
but you tried. all i can ask for:)
